newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: SFE wheat stays firm on drought fears.
newsitem.headline: SFE wheat stays firm on drought fears.

text.p: Sydney Futures Exchange wheat futures stayed firm on Thursday as fears of an El Nino drought continued to dominate.
January 1998 was again the only contract to trade, slipping by 50 cents to A$177.00 on the traded price compared with the previous day's settlement close. Nine lots traded.
Settlement prices edged up mostly by 50 cents, although the two nearest-term contracts slipped by 50 cents to A$1.50.
Chris Gray of C, A & L Bell Commodities said the steady AWB pool price had no effect on the market but drought fears were prompting even growers to join the speculative trade as buyers.
